moves.1. c4: This is my second annotation. I hope everyone liked the last one. Anyway, this was against another 1300, and he also was very good. I want to say thank you to him for the game (I will be playing him again because this is from a mini-tournament.) So, thankyou:)
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. g3 d6 4. Bg2 Bd7 5: I don't really like this move, but I guess it is OK
moves.6. Nd5: Maybe Nf3 was better, but I don't really know.
moves.7... b6 8. Nb4: Yes, the knight is being pinned to the rook, but it is easy to get out of.
moves.9. Qxb4 d5: ? Most people actually fall for this. On first thought, it looks like a harmless move which sort of develops the bishop with tempo. But if you look ahead, this actually loses a pawn.
moves.10. Qb3 d4: ?? WHY????? This isn't very good at all.
moves.16... O-O: ??? By the way, I put three question marks on purpose.
moves.24... Rh4: notice that I cannot take the rook.
And this is checkmate. Hope you liked the annotation. Bye!
